alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Marshall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 3:59PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern DeSoto, northwestern Marshall, Fayette and southeastern Shelby Counties through 430 PM CST... At 359 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Olive Branch, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Collierville, Germantown, Olive Branch, Memphis, Somerville, Warren, Macon, Oakland, Piperton, Rossville, Moscow, Williston, La Grange, Cayce, Handy Corner, Kirk, Pattersonville, Fisherville, Fairhaven and Elba. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
